briefTitle: Haemodynamic Abnormalities Recorded With Cardiac Catheterization Along With Body's Surface Micro-accelerometers (KT-KCG)
officialTitle: Do Abnormal Hemodynamic Features Generate Relevant Reactions and Vibrations at the Skin Level When Recorded by Micro Accelerometers

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age 18 y.o. to 80 y.o.
* Heart failure

Exclusion Criteria:

* Left ventricle assistance device
* Refused participation

primary.measure: Micro-accelerations recorded at the body's surface
primary.description: Analysis of heart-induced velocities (m/s) by the means of micro-accelerometers and secondary computation of the kinetic energy (KE= 1/2 mvÂ²) recorded with the seismocardiography and ballistocardiography at the skin level during cardiac catheterization.
